abstract.t: AMC-ACE-O is a reversible map from a sequence of Unicode [UNICODE]characters to a sequence of letters (A-Z, a-z), digits (0-9), andhyphen-minus (-), henceforth called LDH characters. Such a map(called an 'ASCII-Compatible Encoding', or ACE) might be useful forinternationalized domain names [IDN], because host name labels arecurrently restricted to LDH characters by [RFC952] and [RFC1123].
